variables.title: ⌥ Variables
variables.description: Variables to be used as Jinja prompt templates and in functions as arguments

glossary_document.title: Translation Glossary
glossary_document.description:
Provide a glossary to customize translation and improve accuracy of domain-specific terms.
If not specified or invalid, no glossary will be used. Read about the expected format [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TwzAvFmFYekloRKql2PXNPIyqCbsHRL8ZtnWkzAYrh8/edit?usp=sharing).

detail.description: Details about the status of the run as a human readable string

output.description: Output of the run. Only available if status is `"completed"`

created_at.description: Time when the run was created as ISO format

status_url.title: Status Url
status_url.description: URL to check the status of the run. Also included in the `Location` header of the response.

wa_phone_number__in.title: Wa Phone Number  In
wa_phone_number__in.description: A list of WhatsApp phone numbers to broadcast to.

slack_user_id__in.title: Slack User Id  In
slack_user_id__in.description: A list of Slack user IDs to broadcast to.

slack_user_name__icontains.title: Slack User Name  Icontains
slack_user_name__icontains.description: Filter by the Slack user's name. Case insensitive.

slack_channel_is_personal.title: Slack Channel Is Personal
slack_channel_is_personal.description: Filter by whether the Slack channel is personal. By default, will broadcast to both public and personal slack channels.

text.title: Text
text.description: Message to broadcast to all users

audio.title: Audio
audio.description: Audio URL to send to all users

video.title: Video
video.description: Video URL to send to all users

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Video URL to send to all users

buttons.title: Buttons
buttons.description: Buttons to send to all users

filters.title: Filters
filters.description: Filters to select users to broadcast to. If not provided, will broadcast to all users of this bot.

variables.title: ⌥ Variables
variables.description: Variables to be used as Jinja prompt templates and in functions as arguments

documents.title: Input Data Spreadsheet
documents.description:
Upload or link to a CSV or google sheet that contains your sample input data. 
For example, for Copilot, this would sample questions or for Art QR Code, would would be pairs of image descriptions and URLs. 
Remember to includes header names in your CSV too.

eval_prompts.title: Evaluation Prompts
eval_prompts.description:
Specify custom LLM prompts to calculate metrics that evaluate each row of the input data. The output should be a JSON object mapping the metric names to values.  
_The `columns` dictionary can be used to reference the spreadsheet columns._

agg_functions.title: Aggregations
agg_functions.description: Aggregate using one or more operations. Uses [pandas](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/groupby.html#dataframegroupby-computations-descriptive-stats).

eval_runs.description: List of URLs to the evaluation runs that you requested.

variables.description: Variables to be used as Jinja prompt templates and in functions as arguments

documents.title: Input Data Spreadsheet
documents.description:
Upload or link to a CSV or google sheet that contains your sample input data.
For example, for Copilot, this would sample questions or for Art QR Code, would would be pairs of image descriptions and URLs.
Remember to includes header names in your CSV too.

run_urls.title: Gooey Workflows
run_urls.description:
Provide one or more Gooey.AI workflow runs.
You can add multiple runs from the same recipe (e.g. two versions of your copilot) and we'll run the inputs over both of them.

input_columns.title: Input Column Mappings
input_columns.description: For each input field in the Gooey.AI workflow, specify the column in your input data that corresponds to it.

output_columns.title: Output Column Mappings
output_columns.description: For each output field in the Gooey.AI workflow, specify the column name that you'd like to use for it in the output data.

eval_urls.title: Evaluation Workflows
eval_urls.description: _(optional)_ Add one or more Gooey.AI Evaluator Workflows to evaluate the results of your runs.

conversation_id.title: Conversation Id
conversation_id.description: The conversation ID you provided in the request, or a random ID if not provided

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user ID associated with this conversation

user_message_id.title: User Message Id
user_message_id.description: The user message ID you provided in the request, or a random ID if not provided.

bot_message_id.title: Bot Message Id
bot_message_id.description: The bot message ID. Use this ID as the `context_msg_id` when sending a `button_pressed`.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Time when the conversation was created as ISO format

type.title: Type
type.description: The conversation was started. Save the IDs for future requests.

integration_id.title: Integration Id
integration_id.description: Your Integration ID as shown in the Copilot Integrations tab

conversation_id.title: Conversation Id
conversation_id.description:
The gooey conversation ID.

If not provided, a new conversation will be started and a new ID will be returned in the response. Use this to maintain the state of the conversation between requests.

Note that you may not provide a custom ID here, and must only use the `conversation_id` returned in a previous response.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description:
Your app's custom user ID.

If not provided, a random user will be created and a new ID will be returned in the response. If a `conversation_id` is provided, this field is automatically set to the user's id associated with that conversation.

user_message_id.title: User Message Id
user_message_id.description:
Your app's custom message ID for the user message.

If not provided, a random ID will be generated and returned in the response. This is useful for tracking messages in the conversation.

button_pressed.title: Button Pressed
button_pressed.description: The button that was pressed by the user.

variables.title: ⌥ Variables
variables.description: Variables to be used as Jinja prompt templates and in functions as arguments

doc_extract_url.title: 📚 Document Extract Workflow
doc_extract_url.description: Select a workflow to extract text from documents and images.

document_model.title: 🩻 Photo / Document Intelligence
document_model.description: When your copilot users upload a photo or pdf, what kind of document are they mostly likely to upload? (via [Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/how-to-guides/use-sdk-rest-api?view=doc-intel-3.1.0&tabs=linux&pivots=programming-language-rest-api))

dense_weight.title: Dense Embeddings Weightage
dense_weight.description:
Weightage for dense vs sparse embeddings. `0` for sparse, `1` for dense, `0.5` for equal weight.
Generally speaking, dense embeddings excel at understanding the context of the query, whereas sparse vectors excel at keyword matches.

asr_model.title: Speech-to-Text Provider
asr_model.description: Choose a model to transcribe incoming audio messages to text.

asr_language.title: Spoken Language
asr_language.description: Choose a language to transcribe incoming audio messages to text.

user_language.title: User Language
user_language.description: Choose a language to translate incoming text & audio messages to English and responses back to your selected language. Useful for low-resource languages.

input_glossary_document.title: Input Glossary
input_glossary_document.description: Translation Glossary for User Langauge -> LLM Language (English)

output_glossary_document.title: Output Glossary
output_glossary_document.description: Translation Glossary for LLM Language (English) -> User Langauge

tools.title: 🛠️ Tools
tools.description: Give your copilot superpowers by giving it access to tools. Powered by [Function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling).

stream_url.title: Stream Url
stream_url.description: The URL to stream the conversation. Use Server-Sent Events (SSE) to stream the response.

detail.description: Details about the status of the run as a human readable string

output.title: Output
output.description: Output of the run. Only available if status is `"completed"`

still.title: Still (fewer head motion, works with preprocess 'full')

preprocess.title: Preprocess
preprocess.description: SadTalker only generates 512x512 output. 'crop' handles this by cropping the input to 512x512. 'resize' scales down the input to fit 512x512 and scales it back up after lipsyncing (does not work well for full person images, better for portraits). 'full' processes the cropped region and pastes it back into the original input. 'extcrop' and 'extfull' are similar to 'crop' and 'full' but with extended cropping.

pose_style.title: Pose Style
pose_style.description: Random seed 0-45 inclusive that affects how the pose is animated.

expression_scale.title: Expression Scale
expression_scale.description: Scale the amount of expression motion. 1.0 is normal, 0.5 is very reduced, and 2.0 is quite a lot.

ref_eyeblink.title: Reference Eyeblink
ref_eyeblink.description: Optional reference video for eyeblinks to make the eyebrow movement more natural.

ref_pose.title: Reference Pose
ref_pose.description: Optional reference video to pose the head.

glossary_document.title: Translation Glossary
glossary_document.description:
Provide a glossary to customize translation and improve accuracy of domain-specific terms.
If not specified or invalid, no glossary will be used. Read about the expected format [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TwzAvFmFYekloRKql2PXNPIyqCbsHRL8ZtnWkzAYrh8/edit?usp=sharing).

doc_extract_url.title: 📚 Document Extract Workflow
doc_extract_url.description: Select a workflow to extract text from documents and images.

document_model.title: 🩻 Photo / Document Intelligence
document_model.description: When your copilot users upload a photo or pdf, what kind of document are they mostly likely to upload? (via [Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/how-to-guides/use-sdk-rest-api?view=doc-intel-3.1.0&tabs=linux&pivots=programming-language-rest-api))

dense_weight.title: Dense Embeddings Weightage
dense_weight.description:
Weightage for dense vs sparse embeddings. `0` for sparse, `1` for dense, `0.5` for equal weight.
Generally speaking, dense embeddings excel at understanding the context of the query, whereas sparse vectors excel at keyword matches.

asr_model.title: Speech-to-Text Provider
asr_model.description: Choose a model to transcribe incoming audio messages to text.

asr_language.title: Spoken Language
asr_language.description: Choose a language to transcribe incoming audio messages to text.

user_language.title: User Language
user_language.description: Choose a language to translate incoming text & audio messages to English and responses back to your selected language. Useful for low-resource languages.

input_glossary_document.title: Input Glossary
input_glossary_document.description: Translation Glossary for User Langauge -> LLM Language (English)

output_glossary_document.title: Output Glossary
output_glossary_document.description: Translation Glossary for LLM Language (English) -> User Langauge

tools.title: 🛠️ Tools
tools.description: Give your copilot superpowers by giving it access to tools. Powered by [Function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling).
